4.15.23  2:51 pm   i made a great schedule earlier in the year, and i followed it like my life depended on it. it was great, because it forced me to really move things along and get stuff done. but... something happened - i'm not entirely sure what - and the fear of the deadlines that forced me to get stuff done just vanished. i feel incredibly aimless and i have no idea how to get back on the schedule after i've totally screwed it up. any tips?

4.14.23  5:04 pm   For "more than a dream" in the bit where it goes "dum dum dum woah dreams make sense ", am I right in saying you go to a 2-5-1 in F#major,

      but the second time round you go to Emin7 after the lyric "and the best days you'll beleive again"? .

     Then going to an A major ish chord which would indicate that we're in Dmajor right?

     But you go back to F anyway. I noticed that you also teased a movement to D earlier in the song. In the bit "I can't beleive what I'm seeing , it's more than a dream , it's more than anyone ever dreamed in history" where you go from gmaj7 to Amaj ,

      somewhat suggesting a 4-5 movement relative to D,

      and resolving to D at that point would make sense to the ear

      yet somehow you manage to return to F and still get it to sound natural.

     I'm intrigued as to how you managed wander everywhere harmonically and end up at the same place as if you were never gone.

     I also very much enjoy the Dbmaj7 to Ab maj7 vamp you managed to fit in, and if it isn't too much bother, what chords did u use to get from that vamp back to F major ?
